gurmukhi: Arjn isMG qb FIT hÍY khI ikSn so bwq ]mhwNblI hO Awj hI kirho qyro Gwq ]1209]
transliteration: Arjan Singh Tah Dheeth Havia Kahikishan So Baat|| Mahaanbalihau Aaj Hikariho Tero Ghaat||1209||
translation: Then the obstinate Arjun Singh said to Krishna, “I am a mighty warrior and shall knock you down immediately.”1209.

gurmukhi: sunq bcn hir K`g gih Air isr JwrXo Dwie ]igrXo mno AwNDI bhy bfo biRC murJwie ]1210]
transliteration: Sounat Bachanndhar(i) Khagg Gadh Ar(i) Sir Jhdaryo Dhaae|| Giryo Mano Aandhibade Bado Brichh Murjhaae||1210||
translation: Hearing this, Krishna struck a blow on his head with his dagger and he fell down like a tree in a storm.1210.

gurmukhi: Arjn isMG hnXo Ais so Amrys mhIp hnXo qbhI ]Atlys pY kop BXo liK kY hir Awpny SsqR ley sB hI ]
transliteration: Arjan Singh Banyo As(i) So Amres Maheep Hanyo Tab-hiatlas Pai Kop Bhayo Lakh(i) Kai Har(i) Aapane Shastra Lae Sabh Hee||
translation: Arjun Singh and the king named Amresh Singh were killed with the dagger, then Krishna held his weapons, getting furious on Atlesh;

gurmukhi: Aiq mwr hI mwr pukwr prXo hir swmuih Awie ArXo jb hI ]klDauq ky BUKn AMg sjy ijh kI Cib so sivqw db hI ]1211]
transliteration: At(i) Maar Heet Maar Poukaar Daryo Har(i) Saamuh(i) Saamuh(i) Aaedaryo Jab Hee|| Kaldhaout Ke Bhookhanndan Saje Jih Kichhab(i) So Savitaa Dab Hee||1211||
translation: He also began to say “Kill, Kill”, while coming in front of Krishna; before the glory of his limbs bedecked with gold ornaments, even the sun seemed bedimmed.1211.

gurmukhi: jwm pRmwn kIXo Gmswn bfO blvwn n jwie sMGwrXo ]myG jXoN gwj murwr qbY Ais lY kir mY Air aUpir JwrXo ]
transliteration: Jaam Pramaan Keeyo Ghamsaan Badau Balvaan Na Jaae Sanhdaryo|| Megh Jyon Gadj Muraar Tabai As(i) Lai Kar(i) Mai Ar(i) Oopar(i) Jhdaryo||
translation: He waged a violent war for one Pabar (about three hours), but he could not be killed; then Krishna thundering like the cloud, struck a blow on the enemy with his sword,

gurmukhi: hÍY miRq BUm prXo qb hI jdubIr jbY isr kwit auqwrXo ]DMin hI DMin khY sB dyv vfo hirjU BUA Bwr invwrXo ]1212]
transliteration: Hvai Mrit Bhoom Daryo Tab Hijadoubeer Jabai Sir Kaattee Outdaryo|| Dhann(i) Hidhann(i) Kahai Sabh Dev Vado Har(i)joo Bhooaa Bhaar Nivdaryo||1212||
translation: And when Krishna cut down his head, he died and fell on the earth; seeing this, the gods hailed and said, “O Krishna ! you have lightened a great burden of the earth.”1212.

gurmukhi: Atl isMG jb mwirXo bhu bIrn ko rwau ]Aimt isMG qb Aimt huie kIno ju`D aupwau ]1213]
transliteration: Atal Singh Jab Mdaryo Bahu Bderan Ko Raao|| Amit Singh Tab Amit Hue Keeno Juddh Oupaao||1213||
translation: When Atal Singh, who was the king of many warriors, was killed, then Amit Singh started his efforts for waging war.1213.

gurmukhi: bolq XoN hiT kY hir so Bt qau liKho jb moso lrYgo ]moko khw ien rwjn jXo Cl mUrq hÍY Cl swQ CrYgo ]
transliteration: Dolat Yonhath(i) Kai Har(i) So Bhat Tau Lakhiho Jab Moso Darai-go|| Moko Kahaa In Raajan Jyon Chhal Moondat Hvai Chhal Saath Chdarai-go||
translation: He said to Krishna, “I shall consider you a great warrior, if you fight with me; will you also deceive me like these kings through stratagem?

gurmukhi: mo Aiq kop Bro liKkY rihho nih Awhv hUM qy trYgo ]jau kbhUM iBrho hm so inscY inj dyh ko qXwgu krYgo ]1214]
transliteration: Mo At(i) Kop Bdaro Lakh(i) Kai Raheho Nah(i) Aahev Goon Te Darai-go|| Jau Kab-houn Bhirho Ham So Nischai Nij Deh Ko Tyaag(u) Kara-go||1214||
translation: “You will definitely run away from the field seeing me greatly infuriated and if you fight with me at any time, then you will assuredly leave your body.1214.
